title: Definition of EFFICACY
description: the power to produce an effect... See the full definition
cleaned_text: efficacy [noun](/dictionary/noun) ef·fi·ca·cy [e-fi-k-s](/dictionary/efficacy?pronunciation&lang=en_us&dir=e&file=effica03) plural efficacies Example Sentences In the planner's view, Rumsfeld had two goals: to demonstrate the efficacy of precision bombing and to "do the war on the cheap." —Seymour M. Hersh, New Yorker, 7 Apr. 2003 Vaccines exist, but their efficacy against aerosolized plague is unknown. —Sharon Begley et al., Newsweek, 8 Oct. 2001 ... efficacy does not have to be demonstrated before homeopathic products are marketed. —Alison Abbott et al., Nature, 26 Sept. 1996 questioned the efficacy of the alarms in actually preventing auto theft Recent Examples on the Web Although, there's no evidence that alcohol affects the efficacy of the booster and vaccine. —Claire Gillespie, Health, 31 Aug. 2023 This interaction could potentially increase or decrease the efficacy of certain drugs. —Amber Smith, Discover Magazine, 30 Aug. 2023 Providers can choose a biosimilar based on their preference or the patient's preference, but the clinical efficacy is the same. —Claire Bugos, Verywell Health, 22 Aug. 2023 And these games can't hold a candle to Adderall in terms of their potential efficacy: While one-third of EndeavorOTC users saw real-life improvements in their ADHD symptoms, about 70 percent of Adderall users see greater behavioral changes. —Celia Ford, WIRED, 21 Aug. 2023 Recently Lina Khan, Federal Trade Commission head, said based on prior work in safeguarding the Internet, the FTC could oversee the consumer safety and efficacy of AI. —The Editors, Scientific American, 15 Aug. 2023 Each mask offers a minimum of 94% filtration with some colors achieving 99% filtration efficacy. —Dorian Smith-Garcia, Parents, 18 Aug. 2023 But more recent research suggests that the drug's efficacy might be lower. —Byerin Prater, Fortune Well, 16 Aug. 2023 Clinical trials are currently underway to evaluate the safety profile of delta 8 as well as its efficacy in treating specific conditions. —Amber Smith, Discover Magazine, 16 Aug. 2023 [See More](javascript:void(0)) These examples are programmatically compiled from various online sources to illustrate current usage of the word 'efficacy.' Any opinions expressed in the examples do not represent those of Merriam-Webster or its editors.
